quote-source: Trey Harris, The case of the 500-mile email (was RE: [SAGE] Favorite impossible task?), November 24, 2002.
quote-text:
“It’s not what I *think*,” the chairman replied testily. Â "You see, when
we first noticed this happening, a few days ago–“

"You waited a few DAYS?” I interrupted, a tremor tinging my voice. Â "And you couldn’t send email this whole time?“

"We could send email. Â Just not more than–”

“–500 miles, yes,” I finished for him, “I got that. Â But why didn’t you
call earlier?”

“Well, we hadn’t collected enough data to be sure of what was going on
until just now.” Â Right. Â This is the chairman of *statistics*. “Anyway, I
asked one of the geostatisticians to look into it–”

“Geostatisticians…”

“–yes, and she’s produced a map showing the radius within which we can send email to be slightly more than 500 miles. Â There are a number of destinations within that radius that we can’t reach, either, or reach sporadically, but we can never email farther than this radius.”

“I see,” I said, and put my head in my hands. Â "When did this start? Â A
few days ago, you said, but did anything change in your systems at that
time?“

"Well, the consultant came in and patched our server and rebooted it.
But I called him, and he said he didn’t touch the mail system.”

“Okay, let me take a look, and I’ll call you back,” I said, scarcely
believing that I was playing along. Â It wasn’t April Fool’s Day. Â I tried
to remember if someone owed me a practical joke.

I logged into their department’s server, and sent a few test mails. Â This
was in the Research Triangle of North Carolina, and a test mail to my own account was delivered without a hitch. Â Ditto for one sent to Richmond, and Atlanta, and Washington. Â Another to Princeton (400 miles) worked.

But then I tried to send an email to Memphis (600 miles). Â It failed.
Boston, failed. Â Detroit, failed. Â I got out my address book and started
trying to narrow this down. Â New York (420 miles) worked, but Providence (580 miles) failed.

I was beginning to wonder if I had lost my sanity. Â I tried emailing a
friend who lived in North Carolina, but whose ISP was in Seattle.
Thankfully, it failed. Â If the problem had had to do with the geography of the human recipient and not his mail server, I think I would have broken down in tears.
